api_contracts.description: Returns a simple greeting message with HTTP 200 status code

error_responses.message: Internal server error occurred while processing the request

component_logic.responsibility: Initializes and configures the HTTP server framework with routing infrastructure

interfaces.description: Create and configure FastAPI application instance with default settings
Register all route handlers with the FastAPI application
Start the HTTP server and listen for incoming requests

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI 0.104+ framework for HTTP server. Initialize with default settings (title='Hello World API', version='1.0.0'). Configure CORS if needed (allow all origins for development). Use uvicorn as ASGI server with workers=1 for single-process deployment. Default host='0.0.0.0', port=8000. Implement graceful shutdown handling.

component_logic.responsibility: Handles GET /hello requests and returns formatted response with proper serialization

interfaces.description: Handle GET /hello request and return greeting message as JSON
Format message into response dictionary structure

component_logic.implementation_notes: Decorate hello() method with @app.get('/hello'). Return dict with key 'message' and value 'Hello World'. FastAPI automatically serializes dict to JSON with Content-Type: application/json. No input parameters required. Response status code defaults to 200 OK. Use Pydantic for response validation if needed (optional for this simple case).

component_logic.responsibility: Formats HTTP responses with proper status codes and error handling

interfaces.description: Format successful response with specified status code (default 200)
Format error response with error code and message
Handle unexpected exceptions and return 500 error response

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI JSONResponse for explicit response control. Success responses return status 200 with data payload. Error responses return appropriate HTTP status codes (500 for internal errors). Implement global exception handler using @app.exception_handler(Exception) to catch unhandled exceptions. Log all errors with Python logging module. Never expose internal error details to client (return generic 'Internal server error' message). Set Content-Type: application/json for all responses.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify HTTP server framework is properly initialized and routing is configured
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HTTPServerFramework.initialize_server() must create FastAPI instance. HTTPServerFramework.configure_routes() must register HelloRouteHandler.hello() with @app.get('/hello'). Server must start on specified host and port without errors.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify all exceptions are caught and return proper HTTP error responses
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Global exception handler must be registered. Unhandled exceptions must return 500 status code with error response. No stack traces exposed to client. All errors logged with Python logging module.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response serialization is efficient and uses proper content types
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler.hello() must return dict that FastAPI automatically serializes to JSON. Content-Type header must be 'application/json'. Response must be sent with status code 200.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response format matches API contract specification
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Response must contain exactly one key 'message' with value 'Hello World'. Response must be valid JSON. No additional fields or nested structures.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify component dependencies are correctly wired
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler must depend on HTTPServerFramework. ResponseFormatter must be used by HelloRouteHandler for error cases. No circular dependencies exist.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify no sensitive information is exposed in responses or logs
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Error responses must not contain stack traces or internal implementation details. Logging must not include request/response bodies. No credentials or secrets in any response.

architecture_overview: Simple 3-tier architecture for a minimal HTTP API. HTTPServerFramework layer initializes and manages the FastAPI application with routing configuration. HelloRouteHandler layer implements the GET /hello endpoint that returns a JSON response with greeting message. ResponseFormatter layer handles response serialization and error formatting with proper HTTP status codes. The endpoint receives GET requests at /hello, processes them through HelloRouteHandler, formats the response through ResponseFormatter, and returns JSON with status 200 OK. Global exception handler catches any unhandled errors and returns 500 status with error message.
assumptions: Server runs on localhost:8000 by default (host='0.0.0.0', port=8000)
Single-process deployment (workers=1) is acceptable for this simple endpoint
HTTPS/TLS is handled at infrastructure level (reverse proxy or load balancer)
No authentication or authorization required for /hello endpoint
Response format is JSON with Content-Type: application/json
No database or external service dependencies required
Graceful shutdown on SIGTERM signal is implemented
Logging output goes to stdout/stderr for container environments
